definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: When it comes to public speaking, there are three major avenues you can take to make good money.
sentences.chinese: 在演说者方面，有三种方法可以使你挣得盆满钵满。

sentences.english: He sweats himself to earn as much money as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命干活以挣得尽可能多的钱。

sentences.english: He toiled all day long but earned very little.
sentences.chinese: 他整天劳碌但挣得很少。

sentences.english: I tried my best to get some points for Toyota.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力想为丰田车队挣得一些分数。

sentences.english: They want them to earn more, and shop til they drop.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望中国人挣得更多，然后消费掉。

sentences.english: I can't go back to the village after an M.B.A. Delhi has more money, better quality of life.
sentences.chinese: 新德里生活条件更好，钱挣得也多。

sentences.english: Hawkwood made large sums of money in this way.
sentences.chinese: 霍克沃德用这种方法挣得大笔钱。

sentences.english: They actually don’t want Chinese laborers to earn less and spend little.
sentences.chinese: 他们实际上并不希望中国劳动者挣得少，花的少。

sentences.english: In fact, if you do this, you actually earn risk points.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这样做也会挣得一些冒险分。

sentences.english: Today gang members barely into their teens can earn more money than their parents.
sentences.chinese: 现在，才十几岁的帮派成员就能比他们父母挣得多。

sentences.english: Win them over to your side and you’re almost guaranteed to be earning more.
sentences.chinese: 把他们争取到自己这边，你就差不多保证能挣得更多。

sentences.english: However, you may keep for your own use all overtime income that you may earn.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样，你所有挣得的加班费都由你自己支配。

sentences.english: Oh just calk me and I ll make your day .
sentences.chinese: 请打电话给我，我会挣得你幸运的一天。

sentences.english: Will you be required to recruit new distributors to earn your commission?
sentences.chinese: 你是否被要求要发展新的分享者来挣得你的报酬？

sentences.english: Hawkwood made large sums of money in this way.
sentences.chinese: 沃德用这种方法挣得大笔钱。

definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
